definitions.definition: A group of objects held together by wrapping or tying.
definitions.example: a bundle of straw or of paper; a bundle of old clothes

definitions.definition: A package wrapped or tied up for carrying.
A group of products or services sold together as a unit.
definitions.example: This software bundle includes a wordprocessor, a spreadsheet, and two games.

definitions.definition: A large amount, especially of money.
definitions.example: The inventor of that gizmo must have made a bundle.

definitions.definition: A cluster of closely bound muscle or nerve fibres.
A sequence of two or more words that occur in language with high frequency but are not idiomatic; a chunk, cluster, or lexical bundle.
definitions.example: examples of bundles would include "in accordance with", "the results of" and "so far"

definitions.definition: (Mac OS X) A directory containing related resources such as source code; application bundle.
A quantity of paper equal to two reams (1000 sheets).
A court bundle, the assemblage of documentation prepared for, and referred to during, a court case.
Topological space composed of a base space and fibers projected to the base space.
To tie or wrap together into a bundle.
To hustle; to dispatch something or someone quickly.
To prepare for departure; to set off in a hurry or without ceremony; used with away, off, out.
To dress someone warmly.
To dress warmly. Usually bundle up
To sell hardware and software as a single product.
To hurry.
To hastily or clumsily push, put, carry or otherwise send something into a particular place.
To sleep on the same bed without undressing.
(often with 'on') To jump into a dogpile.
To pile on, to overwhelm in other senses.
